trans-unit.source: Overview and Comparison of Azure On Demand Media Encoders
trans-unit.target: Overview and Comparison of Azure On Demand Media Encoders

trans-unit.source: This topic gives an overview and gives a comparison of Azire On Demand Media encoders.
trans-unit.target: This topic gives an overview and gives a comparison of Azire On Demand Media encoders.

trans-unit.source: Overview and Comparison of Azure On Demand Media Encoders
trans-unit.target: Overview and Comparison of Azure On Demand Media Encoders

trans-unit.source: Encoders compress digital media using codecs.
trans-unit.target: Encoders compress digital media using codecs.

trans-unit.source: Encoders typically have various settings that allow you to specify properties of the media generated for example, the codecs used, file format, resolution, and bitrate.
trans-unit.target: Encoders typically have various settings that allow you to specify properties of the media generated for example, the codecs used, file format, resolution, and bitrate.

trans-unit.source: File formats are containers that hold the compressed video as well as information about what codecs were used to compress the video.
trans-unit.target: File formats are containers that hold the compressed video as well as information about what codecs were used to compress the video.

trans-unit.source: Codecs have two components: one to compress digital media files for transmission and the other to decompress digital media files for playback.
trans-unit.target: Codecs have two components: one to compress digital media files for transmission and the other to decompress digital media files for playback.

trans-unit.source: There are audio codecs that compress and decompress audio and video codecs that compress and decompress video.
trans-unit.target: There are audio codecs that compress and decompress audio and video codecs that compress and decompress video.

trans-unit.source: Codecs can use lossless or lossy compression.
trans-unit.target: Codecs can use lossless or lossy compression.

trans-unit.source: Lossless codecs preserve all of the information when compression occurs.
trans-unit.target: Lossless codecs preserve all of the information when compression occurs.

trans-unit.source: When the file is decompressed, the result is a file that is identical to the input media, making lossless codecs well suited to archiving and storage.
trans-unit.target: When the file is decompressed, the result is a file that is identical to the input media, making lossless codecs well suited to archiving and storage.

trans-unit.source: Lossy codecs lose some of the information when encoding and produce smaller files (than the original) at the cost of video quality and are well suited to streaming over the internet.
trans-unit.target: Lossy codecs lose some of the information when encoding and produce smaller files (than the original) at the cost of video quality and are well suited to streaming over the internet.

trans-unit.source: It is important to understand the difference between codecs and file formats.
trans-unit.target: It is important to understand the difference between codecs and file formats.

trans-unit.source: Codecs are the software that implements the compression/decompression algorithms whereas file formats are containers that hold the compressed video.
trans-unit.target: Codecs are the software that implements the compression/decompression algorithms whereas file formats are containers that hold the compressed video.

trans-unit.source: Media Services provides dynamic packaging which allows you to deliver your adaptive bitrate MP4 or Smooth Streaming encoded content in streaming formats supported by Media Services (MPEG DASH, HLS, Smooth Streaming, HDS) without you having to re-package into these streaming formats.
trans-unit.target: Media Services provides dynamic packaging which allows you to deliver your adaptive bitrate MP4 or Smooth Streaming encoded content in streaming formats supported by Media Services (MPEG DASH, HLS, Smooth Streaming, HDS) without you having to re-package into these streaming formats.

trans-unit.source: To take advantage of [dynamic packaging](media-services-dynamic-packaging-overview.md), you need to do the following:
trans-unit.target: To take advantage of [dynamic packaging](media-services-dynamic-packaging-overview.md), you need to do the following:

trans-unit.source: Encode your mezzanine (source) file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files (the encoding steps are demonstrated later in this tutorial).
trans-unit.target: Encode your mezzanine (source) file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files (the encoding steps are demonstrated later in this tutorial).

trans-unit.source: Get at least one On-Demand streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.
trans-unit.target: Get at least one On-Demand streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Scale On-Demand Streaming Reserved Units](media-services-manage-origins.md#scale_streaming_endpoints/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Scale On-Demand Streaming Reserved Units](media-services-manage-origins.md#scale_streaming_endpoints/).

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports the following on demand encoders that are described in this article:
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports the following on demand encoders that are described in this article:

trans-unit.source: This article gives a brief overview of on demand media encoders and provides links to articles that give more detailed information.
trans-unit.target: This article gives a brief overview of on demand media encoders and provides links to articles that give more detailed information.

trans-unit.source: The topic also provides comparison of the encoders.
trans-unit.target: The topic also provides comparison of the encoders.

trans-unit.source: Note that by default each Media Services account can have one active encoding task at a time.
trans-unit.target: Note that by default each Media Services account can have one active encoding task at a time.

trans-unit.source: You can reserve encoding units that allow you to have multiple encoding tasks running concurrently, one for each encoding reserved unit you purchase.
trans-unit.target: You can reserve encoding units that allow you to have multiple encoding tasks running concurrently, one for each encoding reserved unit you purchase.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to use the Media Encoder Standard encoder.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to use the Media Encoder Standard encoder.

trans-unit.source: However, it is currently not exposed via the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: However, it is currently not exposed via the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: When compared to Azure Media Encoder, this encoder supports more input and output formats and codecs.
trans-unit.target: When compared to Azure Media Encoder, this encoder supports more input and output formats and codecs.

trans-unit.source: More tolerant to how the input file was created
trans-unit.target: More tolerant to how the input file was created

trans-unit.source: Has a better H.264 codec quality than the Azure Media Encoder
trans-unit.target: Has a better H.264 codec quality than the Azure Media Encoder

trans-unit.source: Is built on a newer and more flexible pipeline
trans-unit.target: Is built on a newer and more flexible pipeline

trans-unit.source: How to encode with Media Encoder Standard
trans-unit.target: How to encode with Media Encoder Standard

trans-unit.source: Media Encoder Standard is configured using one of the encoder presets described [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=618336&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: Media Encoder Standard is configured using one of the encoder presets described [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=618336&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: The encoders input metadata is described [here](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783120.aspx) (same as Azure Media Encoder).
trans-unit.target: The encoders input metadata is described [here](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783120.aspx) (same as Azure Media Encoder).

trans-unit.source: The encoders output metadata is described [here](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783217.aspx) (same as Azure Media Encoder).
trans-unit.target: The encoders output metadata is described [here](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783217.aspx) (same as Azure Media Encoder).

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Encoder is one of the encoders supported by Media Services.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Encoder is one of the encoders supported by Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Starting with July 2015, it is recommended to use [Media Encoder Standard](media-services-encode-asset.md#media_encoder_standard).
trans-unit.target: Starting with July 2015, it is recommended to use [Media Encoder Standard](media-services-encode-asset.md#media_encoder_standard).

trans-unit.source: How to encode with Azure Media Encoder
trans-unit.target: How to encode with Azure Media Encoder

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Encoder is configured using one of the encoder presets described [here](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn619392.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Encoder is configured using one of the encoder presets described [here](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn619392.aspx).

trans-unit.source: You can also get the actual Azure Media Encoder preset files [here](https://github.com/Azure/azure-media-services-samples/tree/master/Encoding%20Presets/VoD/Azure%20Media%20Encoder).
trans-unit.target: You can also get the actual Azure Media Encoder preset files [here](https://github.com/Azure/azure-media-services-samples/tree/master/Encoding%20Presets/VoD/Azure%20Media%20Encoder).

trans-unit.source: The encoders input metadata is described [here](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783120.aspx).
trans-unit.target: The encoders input metadata is described [here](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783120.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The encoders output metadata is described [here](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783217.aspx).
trans-unit.target: The encoders output metadata is described [here](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783217.aspx).

trans-unit.source: How to modify the output file names
trans-unit.target: How to modify the output file names

trans-unit.source: Encoding your media with Dolby Digital Plus
trans-unit.target: Encoding your media with Dolby Digital Plus

trans-unit.source: Media Encoder Premium Workflow is configured using complex workflows.
trans-unit.target: Media Encoder Premium Workflow is configured using complex workflows.

trans-unit.source: Workflow files could be created and updated using the [Workflow Designer](media-services-workflow-designer.md) tool.
trans-unit.target: Workflow files could be created and updated using the [Workflow Designer](media-services-workflow-designer.md) tool.

trans-unit.source: Billing meter used by each encoder
trans-unit.target: Billing meter used by each encoder

trans-unit.source: Encoding Tasks will be charged according to the size of the output Asset, in GBytes, at the rate specified [here][1], under the ENCODER column.
trans-unit.target: Encoding Tasks will be charged according to the size of the output Asset, in GBytes, at the rate specified [here][1], under the ENCODER column.

trans-unit.source: Encoding Tasks will be charged according to the size of the output Asset, in GBytes, at the rate specified [here][1], under the ENCODER column.
trans-unit.target: Encoding Tasks will be charged according to the size of the output Asset, in GBytes, at the rate specified [here][1], under the ENCODER column.

trans-unit.source: Encoding Tasks will be charged according to the size of the output Asset, in GBytes, at the rate specified [here][1], under the PREMIUM ENCODER column.
trans-unit.target: Encoding Tasks will be charged according to the size of the output Asset, in GBytes, at the rate specified [here][1], under the PREMIUM ENCODER column.

trans-unit.source: This section compares the encoding capabilities of **Media Encoder Standard**, **Azure Media Encoder**, and **Media Encoder Premium Workflow**.
trans-unit.target: This section compares the encoding capabilities of **Media Encoder Standard**, **Azure Media Encoder**, and **Media Encoder Premium Workflow**.

trans-unit.source: MPEG-2 (up to 422 Profile and High Level; including variants such as XDCAM, XDCAM HD, XDCAM IMX, CableLabs® and D10)
trans-unit.target: MPEG-2 (up to 422 Profile and High Level; including variants such as XDCAM, XDCAM HD, XDCAM IMX, CableLabs® and D10)

trans-unit.source: AAC (AAC-LC, AAC-HE, and AAC-HEv2; up to 5.1)
trans-unit.target: AAC (AAC-LC, AAC-HE, and AAC-HEv2; up to 5.1)

trans-unit.source: AVC (H.264; 8-bit; up to High Profile, Level 5.2; 4K Ultra HD; AVC Intra)
trans-unit.target: AVC (H.264; 8-bit; up to High Profile, Level 5.2; 4K Ultra HD; AVC Intra)

trans-unit.source: MPEG-2 (up to 422 Profile and High Level; including variants such as XDCAM, XDCAM HD, XDCAM IMX, CableLabs® and D10)
trans-unit.target: MPEG-2 (up to 422 Profile and High Level; including variants such as XDCAM, XDCAM HD, XDCAM IMX, CableLabs® and D10)

trans-unit.source: AAC (AAC-LC, AAC-HE, and AAC-HEv2; up to 5.1)
trans-unit.target: AAC (AAC-LC, AAC-HE, and AAC-HEv2; up to 5.1)
